channel.title: BBC News - Asia

item.title: Afghanistan: Terror attack warning issued for Kabul airport
item.description: The US, Australia and the UK have all told citizens and visa holders not to travel to the airport.

item.title: Japan suspends 1.6 million Moderna doses over contamination fears
item.description: About 1.63 million vials are withheld after 'foreign objects' were detected in some doses.

item.title: Australian farmer draws heart with sheep in tribute to aunt
item.description: The Australian man was unable to attend his aunt's funeral because of Covid travel restrictions.

item.title: Bilal Sarwary: 'The plane hit the tower and all our lives changed'
item.description: Afghan journalist Bilal Sarwary was selling carpets when 9/11 happened. From that day on, everything changed.

item.title: Thai police chief, known as Jo Ferrari, wanted over viral torture clip
item.description: Widely known as "Jo Ferrari", the now-sacked officer is being sought over a drug suspect's death.

item.title: India woman who accused MP of rape dies in self-immolation
item.description: Her death puts the spotlight on the treatment of women in India.

item.title: South Korea becomes first major Asian economy to raise interest rates
item.description: The move comes as central banks around the world prepare to exit emergency stimulus measures.

item.title: China schools: 'Xi Jinping Thought' introduced into curriculum
item.description: The education ministry says the guidelines will help establish Marxist belief in the country's youth.

item.title: Paralympics begin with powerful opening ceremony
item.description: The Tokyo 2020 Paralympics are officially under way after a powerful opening ceremony.

item.title: Afghanistan: World Bank halts aid after Taliban takeover
item.description: The announcement comes after the International Monetary Fund halted aid to Afghanistan last week.

item.title: Kamala Harris trip delayed over possible 'Havana syndrome' case
item.description: A "possible anomalous health incident" in Hanoi delayed the US vice-president's flight to Vietnam.

item.title: Afghanistan: Secret Kabul talks between CIA and Taliban - US media
item.description: The secret meeting came ahead of a deadline for US troops to leave Afghanistan on 31 August.

item.title: Afghanistan: 'The pain of watching my country burn from afar'
item.description: Hundreds of Afghan have taken refuge in India but they are worried about their families back home.

item.title: Afghanistan: The 'undefeated' Panjshir Valley - an hour from Kabul
item.description: The Panjshir Valley has been a flashpoint in Afghanistan's turbulent history - now it's happening again.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: The Games with a record number of LGBTQ athletes
item.description: As the Paralympics get under way, athletes reflect on how much more inclusive the Games have become.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: The lowdown on being disabled in Japan
item.description: From moon riders to job quotas, three residents give the lowdown on being disabled in Japan.

item.title: How Afghanistan rattled Asia and emboldened China
item.description: US VP Kamala Harris tries to reassure Asian allies, as many ask: can they still trust America?

item.title: Kamala Harris joins diplomatic charm offensive in South East Asia
item.description: The US vice-president's trip to the region falls in the shadow of a chaotic withdrawal from Afghanistan.
